workExp.title: NTConcepts Software Development Intern
workExp.description: The internship program involved working on an AI/ML Research Trends Dashboard Project. This project displayed points representing authors, their works, and the topics of their works and how they were connected through lines between them. I worked on the API of the project, where I created complex cypher queries to collect data from a Neo4j graph database. My team also implemented serializers to convert data to JSON format using Django REST Framework. We worked in an Agile environment, had daily scrum meetings, and used Jira and Confluence to document and track workflow.

workExp.title: NTConcepts Software Development Intern
workExp.description: For this internship, I worked on the front-end for the Demystifying Classifier Performance Dashboard. The project was demonstrating how images were able to be classified in the black box. My team worked with React JS, SCSS/CSS, and HTML. This was my first experience working with front end technologies. My team also often collaborated with the API team to connect the front and back end code. Once again, this project was made in an Agile environment and used Jira and Confluence for documentation.

workExp.title: NTConcepts Software Development Intern
workExp.description: During this internship, I worked with full-time employees on an existing project supporting an intelligence community customer. I coded in both the front end and API component for the application. The technologies I used were React JS, Java, Quarkus, Keycloak, and GraphQL. I worked to improve the application functionality, find and fix various bugs, update the styling and JavaScript code formatting, and test GraphQL usage in the back end. I also participated in daily scrum meetings and used Jira and Confluence to document my progress with each task.

otherExp.title: Lightsaber Club Outreach Officer
otherExp.description: The Lightsaber Club at Virginia Tech is a club that allows people to build their own lightsabers. Members can design a hilt in a 3D modeling software, which is then 3D printed by the club to be put on a steel pipe. They can also add electronics, which involves soldering and a small amount of programming to set up the board that controls the light and sound. I was involved in the club for a couple years before I became a board member midway through my junior year after the original club board graduated. I transported the materials to and from meetings, helped members who were having trouble with the construction process, and worked on updating the website when new sabers were built.
